title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.4: AWARENESS AND ADVOCACY

description.narrative: A protective environment is enabled through enhanced awareness and advocacy, including for risk education, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children at risk of violence, abuse and exploitation benefit from improved prevention, protection and response interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A protective environment is enabled through enhanced awareness and advocacy, including for risk education

description.narrative: Social mobilization and engagement of communities to raise awareness and advocacy on child protection issues reached more than 1.2 million children and caregivers, with an additional 27 million views for the national social media campaign on positive parenting and COVID-19 prevention. UNICEF also continued to co-chair the Country Task Force on Monitoring and Reporting (CTFMR), leading in the data collection, response and advocacy on the grave violations committed against children in times of armed conflict. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2022
